metadata.name: Mafenide acetate 50 g 1 Powder for solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Indicated for use as an adjunctive topical antimicrobial agent to control bacterial infection when used under moist dressings over meshed autografts on excised burn wounds label

contraindications.disease: Since mafenide is metabolized to a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor metabolic acidosis could occur

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of methemoglobinemia can be increased when Mafenide is combined with Prilocaine
The risk or severity of methemoglobinemia can be increased when Dapsone is combined with Mafenide
The serum concentration of Magnesium can be decreased when it is combined with Mafenide
Mafenide may decrease the excretion rate of Benzylpenicillin which could result in a higher serum level
